standards.description: Count to 100 by ones and by tens
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Count to 100 by ones and by tens.

standards.description: Fluently add and subtract within 20 using mental strategies
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Fluently add and subtract within 20 using mental strategies. By end of Grade 2, know from memory all sums of two one-digit numbers.

standards.description: Interpret products of whole numbers
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Interpret products of whole numbers, e.g., interpret 5 x 7 as the total number of objects in 5 groups of 7 objects each.

standards.description: Explain why a fraction a/b is equivalent to a fraction (n x a)/(n x b)
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Explain why a fraction a/b is equivalent to a fraction (n x a)/(n x b) by using visual fraction models, with attention to how the number and size of the parts differ even though the two fractions themselves are the same size.

standards.description: Use a pair of perpendicular number lines to define a coordinate system
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Use a pair of perpendicular number lines, called axes, to define a coordinate system, with the intersection of the lines arranged to coincide with the 0 on each line and a given point in the plane located by using an ordered pair of numbers, called its coordinates.

standards.description: Write, read, and evaluate expressions in which letters stand for numbers
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Write, read, and evaluate expressions in which letters stand for numbers.

standards.description: Recognize and represent proportional relationships between quantities
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Recognize and represent proportional relationships between quantities.

standards.description: Understand that a function is a rule that assigns to each input exactly one output
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Understand that a function is a rule that assigns to each input exactly one output. The graph of a function is the set of ordered pairs consisting of an input and the corresponding output.

standards.description: Solve linear equations and inequalities in one variable
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Solve linear equations and inequalities in one variable, including equations with coefficients represented by letters.

standards.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

standards.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

standards.description: Determine the main idea of a text; recount the key details and explain how they support the main idea
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Determine the main idea of a text; recount the key details and explain how they support the main idea.

standards.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information.

standards.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

standards.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

standards.description: Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text, including determining where the text leaves matters uncertain.

standards.description: Make observations of plants and animals to compare the diversity of life in different habitats
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Make observations of plants and animals to compare the diversity of life in different habitats.

standards.description: Plan and conduct an investigation to provide evidence of the effects of balanced and unbalanced forces
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Plan and conduct an investigation to provide evidence of the effects of balanced and unbalanced forces on the motion of an object.

standards.description: Represent data in graphical displays to reveal patterns of daily changes in length and direction of shadows
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Represent data in graphical displays to reveal patterns of daily changes in length and direction of shadows, day and night, and the seasonal appearance of some stars in the night sky.

standards.description: Analyze and interpret data to provide evidence for the effects of resource availability on organisms and populations of organisms
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Analyze and interpret data to provide evidence for the effects of resource availability on organisms and populations of organisms in an ecosystem.

standards.description: Analyze and interpret data on the properties of substances before and after the substances interact
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Analyze and interpret data on the properties of substances before and after the substances interact to determine if a chemical reaction has occurred.

standards.description: Construct an explanation based on evidence for how geoscience processes have changed Earth's surface
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Construct an explanation based on evidence for how geoscience processes have changed Earth's surface at varying time and spatial scales.

standards.description: Construct an explanation based on evidence for how the structure of DNA determines the structure of proteins
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Construct an explanation based on evidence for how the structure of DNA determines the structure of proteins, which carry out the essential functions of life through systems of specialized cells.

standards.description: Understand and explain basic principles of the United States government
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Understand and explain basic principles of the United States government including the purposes of government as identified in the Preamble of the Constitution.

standards.description: Describe how trade among people and countries is based on natural resources and economic specialization
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Describe how trade among people and countries is based on natural resources and economic specialization.

standards.description: Describe how different historical events relate to changes in political ideas
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Describe how different historical events shaped political ideas and movements (e.g., the American Revolution's effect on political thinking).

standards.description: Explain how people interact with and modify the physical environment
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Explain how people interact with and modify the physical environment (e.g., clearing forests for farmland, building dams).

standards.description: Determine the historical events and processes that brought about changes in the United States foreign policy
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Determine the historical events and processes that brought about changes in United States foreign policy over time.

standards.description: Describe how modern political positions are affected by differences in ideologies and viewpoints
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Describe how modern political positions are affected by differences in ideologies and viewpoints that have developed over time.

standards.description: Use the periodic table as a model to predict the relative properties of elements
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Use the periodic table as a model to predict the relative properties of elements based on the patterns of electrons in the outermost energy level of atoms.
